name: DC Comics - The New 52 Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: A mysterious figure in purple appears in each of the first issues.  She is often hidden and never speaks but is always watching.  Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Pandora.

	Pandora's name is never mentioned in those first issues.  It isn't until later that we find out who she is.

questions.text: In "The Fury of Firestorm", what relationship do Ronald Raymond and Jason Rusch have with one another.
questions.correct: They are school mates who do not like each other
options: They are step-brothers who are estranged
They are best friends with a passion for science
Ronald is a teacher and Jason is a student
questions.explanation:
They are school mates who do not like each other.

	Jason believes Ronald to be just a dumb jock and Ronald feels Jason is an arrogant know-it-all, however after an attack at the school they both get imbued with powers.  Ronald has fire like abilities and Jason can atomically restructure matter.

questions.text: Which of the following characters is not a part of the "Teen Titans"?
questions.explanation:
Artemis.

	Artemis is not a part of "Teen Titans" in the New 52 but she can be seen in the cartoon "Young Justice" as part of their team.

questions.text: Which incarnation of Robin is featured in the Batman books?
questions.explanation:
Damian Wayne.

	Both Richard and Tim are acknowledged as former Batman proteges in the new 52 while Stephanie acted as Robin for a very brief time before the New 52 came about.  Damian is currently Robin and struggles with what his father is teaching him and what he learned when he was with the League of Assassins.

questions.text: Which of the following books features Jason Todd, Princess Koriand'r, and Roy Harper?
questions.explanation:
"Red Hood and the Outlaws".

	"Red Hood and the Outlaws" features Jason Todd as the Red Hood, Princess Koriand'r as Starfire, and Roy Harper as Arsenal.

questions.text: How many of the New 52 comics feature a Justice League team?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	The three titles are "Justice League", "Justice League of America", "Justice League International", and "Justice League Dark".

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about "The Birds of Prey"?
options: They are considered wanted by the police
Katana speaks with her dead husband in her mystical sword
questions.explanation:
Oracle leads the team.

	In the former version of the "Birds of Prey" Oracle sent the team out on their missions.  However, in the New 52 Barbara Gordon is no longer in a wheelchair and is patrolling the city as Batgirl.

questions.text: In the first four issues of "Aquaman", the main issue is centered around what threat?
questions.correct: Carnivorous humanoids from a newly open trench
options: Black Manta attempting to poison the oceans of the world
How Mera's people were trying to assassinate Aquaman
questions.explanation:
Carnivorous humanoids from a newly open trench.

	Those carnivorous creatures lovingly referred to us humans as the food.

questions.text: In "Green Lantern", who comes to Earth to give Hal Jordan a synthetic power ring that will keep Hal completely at his mercy?
questions.explanation:
Sinestro.

	As the series opens up we find that Hal has fallen out of favor with the Guardians.  However, Sinestro decides that Hal may be of use so he has his own power ring create one for Hal.  This keeps Hal at the mercy of Sinestro.

questions.text: Which of the following romantic connections has continued from the former DC universe into the New 52?
questions.explanation:
Batman and Catwoman.

	We discover that Batman and Catwoman have a rather tricky romantic relationship in the first few issues of Catwoman. Wonder Girl and Superboy start out as enemies in the Teen Titans although as they were fighting there seemed to be some inner attraction. Red Hood and Starfire were never together in the previous universe but it is hinted that they have had a rather casual romance in the New 52. Barry Allen is dating someone else when the new 52 begins but Iris West is a character within the book.
